intro: Dalzielia oblanceolata, commonly known as the broad-leaved dalzielia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its compound leaves and showy flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are broad and ovate, with a smooth or slightly hairy surface, while its flowers are usually yellow or orange, arranged in clusters. Dalzielia oblanceolata is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
